c:complexType.name: BulletChartOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Bullet chart.

c:property.name: bullet
c:property.c:documentation: The bullet plot is the main plot of the bullet chart, which means that its properties may be used without the "bullet" property suffix.

c:complexType.name: BulletPlotOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Bullet plot.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for various visual elements of the chart.

c:complexType.name: BulletPlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the bullet plot type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: bullet)
extension property (ex: panel)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: bulletPanel_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the bullet plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as panel_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: panel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the bullet panel mark.
